title: The Multi-faceted Aspects of Krishna | Sri Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa | SB 6.9.21 | 23.07.2024
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.text: Reading from Srimad Bhagavatam, Canto 6, Chapter 9, entitled, The Appearance of the Demon, Prithrasura.
translation and purport by His Divine Grace Śrīla Prabhupāda
The demigods said the three worlds are created by the five elements namely ether, air, fire, water and earth,
which are controlled by various demigods, beginning from Lord Brahmā.
Being very much afraid that the time factor will end our existence,
we offer presentations unto time by performing our work
The time factor himself, however, is afraid of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
Therefore, let us now worship that Supreme Lord who alone can give us full protection.
When one is afraid of being killed, one must take shelter of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
He is worshipped by all the demigods, beginning from Brahmā.
Although they are in charge of the various elements of the material world.
The words vibheti asmād indicate that all the demons, regardless of how great and powerful,
fear the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
The demigods, being afraid of death, took shelter of the Lord and offered Him these prayers.
Although the time factor is fearful to everyone, fear personified is afraid of the Supreme Lord,
who is therefore known as abhaya, fearless.
Taking shelter of the Supreme Lord brings actual fearlessness
and therefore the demigods decided to take shelter of the Lord.
When Kṛṣṇa had appeared 5000 years ago,
When Kṛṣṇa was about probably around one year old,
Yasodamāyī was sitting in her house
and she was churning the curd,
She was churning to take out the butter,
so that she could feed Kṛṣṇa with it.
And Kṛṣṇa at that time, He was feeling hungry.
He walked up to His mother
and started pulling her, pestering her,
that I am hungry, I want milk.
and started feeding Him her breast milk.
And while Kṛṣṇa was drinking His mother's milk,
on the fireplace, she had placed
one pot of milk to boil.
And this milk was a special milk
which was meant for feeding Kṛṣṇa.
And that milk started boiling and overflowing.
oh, if this milk boils over
then what will my Kṛṣṇa drink?
So she immediately removed Kṛṣṇa from her lap,
set Him down and ran to the kitchen.
To remove the milk from the fireplace.
And it would have taken some time,
she had to remove the milk
and then put off the fire
and if some milk had been spilt over,
clean up and all those kind of things.
Some time it took and she came back.
our Kṛṣṇa is not someone who is going to wait for anyone.
How Mother Yasoda can put me down
when I am hungry and I am drinking her milk?
How she can put me down and go away?
I will show her what I am.
So He looked around and what to do?
He looked at the pot of curd
that Mother Yasoda had been churning.
He took a stone and broke that pot.
And even, you know, all small children also
they will do something naughty like that.
now what is going to be the consequence?
You know, when we grow up,
we first think of the consequence
They first act and then think of the consequence.
So Kṛṣṇa also broke the pot.
So better I scoot from here.
after cleaning up the kitchen or whatever,
He must have gone to play or something.
that the pot of curd has been broken
and the curd is all spilled over.
Nobody can come into the house and do all this.
Krishna only must have done this.
After all, she is a mother.
Who can know her son better than her?
I will teach you a lesson today.
and he was taking out the butter
and he was feeding all the monkeys.
Yasoda Mai walked up behind him,
He left everything and started running.
She was also not going to give up.
Today I have to teach him one lesson.
And you know how difficult it is to catch children.
in that three to five year age guru,
And you know how difficult it is
She will not be able to do it.
Yasoda Mai is trying to catch,
but she is not able to
But she was also not giving up.
I am going to catch Krishna today.
I am not going to give up.
mother is going to do now?
Let us see what you do.
the trees could have fallen on Krishna.
What would have been his state?
so I have to go now.
let him grow a little more.
your duration of life is over.
it's not just limited to the Earth Planet.
He has to give up his body,
go on to the next body.
The Gopi, Yashodamai, took a rope in her hand to tie you to the wooden mortar.
There were a flood of tears flowing down your cheeks.
And all the mascara was getting washed away.
And you are in great fear of Yashodamai.
And death is another form of Kala or time.
The Kala, the time factor, is so fearful to all the Devatas.
And you are the controller of that time factor.
You are crying in fear of Yashodamai.
When I remember this, I am bewildered.
This is a completely inconceivable thing.
Death carries out its duties very impartially and very strictly.
Why is death, why is Kala so impartial?
Because Kala or death is very much afraid.
If I don't do my duty properly, Krishna will punish me.
So that death is afraid of Krishna.
And that Krishna is afraid of a simple cowherd woman.
When I think of this, it's very, very bewildering.
How can such a great personality,
Be afraid of a simple woman like Yashodamai?
Is not limited only to Kunti Maharani.
In the Srimad Bhagavatam, in the 10th canto,
She thought Krishna is my son.
He is that unmanifest Supreme Lord.
Who is not visible to everybody.
It's not that Krishna is an ordinary person.
He is such a great person.
Only to whom Krishna reveals himself,
She tied him to a wooden mortar.
Who is not visible to everybody.
If they want to see Krishna,
They have to go to the shore of,
And then they have to chant the Purusha Sukta prayers.
Even then Paramatma also is not visible to them.
He will only give instructions to Brahma in the heart.
When will we have darshan of the lotus feet of,
How much tougher it will be to see Krishna.
As if Krishna is just another ordinary child,
Took him and tied him to the wooden mat.
There is a facet of Krishna,
When the point of death comes,
They will all become completely afraid.
That death who frightens everyone else,
Including all the Devatas, demons, everybody,
Devotees are all completely surrendered to Krishna.
They have taken shelter of the lotus feet of Krishna.
To those people who have taken shelter of him,
To whom he is giving protection,
A person whom we all have to fear,
So that is one facet of Krishna.
And normally in all other scriptures,
Only this facet of the Supreme Lord,
If you don't follow his rules,
He will put you into hell.
You will have to undergo so much misery.
So this fearful aspect of Krishna,
Those who are not very civilized people,
Very commonly you will find it.
But it's only in the Srimad Bhagavatam,
Where Krishna is shown to have,
Brings out in the tenth canto of the Srimad Bhagavatam.
When he was about ten years and six months old,
Which had been organized by Kamsa.
Kamsa had made a big plan,
In the name of a Mela,
He had called all his allies,
And then he had called some yogis,
And he had also invited all the,
Like that he sent an invitation to,
That we are organizing a big festival,
All these people had come to Mathura,
And there was a big stadium,
The kings were given one position,
Who had come from other villages,
They were given another separate area,
He called all his close associates,
The person who is supposed to kill me,
Ten and a half years old,
They have killed all of them,
He must have killed all the other asuras,
And they started flexing their biceps,
And all those kind of things,
And there is lot of music,
And so many other things going on,
Krishna is such a charismatic personality,
This is the person who has come,
Who can match the beauty of Krishna,
Why did they think like that,
Were in the center of the arena,
In the center of the stadium,
Kamsa was talking to us about,
This is not going to be,
This is not going to be,
He is the best of men,
He is a very powerful person,
Who is stepping into the stadium,
When he is entering the arena,
From the lotus feet of Krishna, a great river has come out. Ganga has come out from the lotus feet of Krishna.
See, from a lotus, water has come out. Not water, a big river has come out.
You see how inconceivable this is. Water can never come from a lotus. Lotus always comes from water.
But in the case of Krishna, it is the reverse. Water comes from his lotus feet.
So this demonstrates the inconceivable nature of Krishna.
So therefore, as devotees of Krishna, we can appreciate the multifaceted aspects of Krishna, his character.
Not only his feature of being fear personified, being fearful to fear personified,
so sweet that he becomes afraid of his own devotee.
So this is... when we understand this feature of Krishna, we can understand the Absolute Truth in full.
That is why only by Bhakti, pure devotional service, we can understand the Supreme Absolute Truth in completeness.
So the Devatas, they are also devotees, but they are Sakama Bhaktas.
They are not Ananya Bhaktas. And so therefore,
for them, Krishna is somebody whom we have to bow down to, whom we have to be always afraid of,
whom even fear personified fears. This is how they appreciate.
But when Bhagavatam reveals, that is not the only feature of Krishna.
If you have to understand Krishna in fullness, you have to understand Esodhamai, and how Krishna is afraid.
That Krishna whom even fear personified fears, is afraid of Esodhamai, his own devotee.
So this is the full understanding.
So this is the full understanding of Krishna.
understanding of the Supreme Absolute Truth which is revealed in the pages of the Srimad
Bhagavatam and further revealed to us by Chaitanya Mahaprabhu and so mercifully revealed to all
of us by Srila Prabhupada without his, without Prabhupada's books, without Prabhupada's
teachings, where we could have understood all these things?
Why Krishna is afraid of Yashoda Mai and why all these different people are seeing Krishna
We would never have been able to understand all this.
The inconceivable nature of Krishna, we would never have been able to grasp it and all this
is possible simply because of our beloved spiritual master Srila Prabhupada's compassion.
Because of his mercy, we are able to understand this and so therefore, we should study the
Srimad Bhagavatam very seriously and that will give us access to the sweet feature of
Krishna, which is otherwise inaccessible to everybody.
If there are any questions or comments, do we have time for questions?
Anybody has any question or comment?
